IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: THE ARK, INC. PROVIDES MEDICAL, DENTAL, COUNSELING, FOOD, LEGAL, EMERGENCY SHELTER AND SOCIAL SUPPORT SERVICES TO LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES OF THE GREATER CHICAGO METROPOLITAN AREA.
IRS990.MissionDescription: 1. To create a safety net for Chicagoland Jews in need by providing vital human services within a framework of Jewish values and laws. 2. To build bridges between volunteers and those in need in our community.
IRS990.Description: Social Service Assistance: Provides case management, food, rent, utility and financial assistance, legal aid and job counseling to low-income individuals and families. 3,650 clients served.

Activity2.Description: Thrift Shop - distributes clothing and household items to low-income individuals and families, and sells donated merchandise to the public. The Thrift Shop enables people to donate to those in need.

Activity3.Description: Emergency Residence: Provides shelter and case management for those temporarily homeless due to eviction, loss of income, or other crisis. 73 clients served.

ActivityOther.Description: Clinic: Provides medical services, primarily through volunteer physicians and medical professionals, including blood tests and other diagnostic procedures, medications, eyeglasses, and mobility and post-operative aids. 745 clients served.

INTENSIVE DAY PROGRAM: addresses the needs of individuals who suffer from chronic mental illness. Oversees clients housing and budgeting, offers family support; provides therapeutic classes, group activities, communal meals. 137 clients served.
VOLUNTEER AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH: recruits and manages over 2,000 professional and lay volunteers; develops volunteer activities.
SPiRITUAL ENRICHMENT: provides classes, pastoral counseling, holiday celebrations, and assistance with life-cycle events.
DENTAL PROGRAM: provides dental services, through volunteer dentists, including cleanings, fillings, extractions, dental X-rays, and other diagnostic and treatment procedures. 340 clients served.
PSYCHOLOGICAL SERVICES: provides psychological counseling by volunteer psychiatrists, psychologists, social workers and counselors, assisted by student interns. 90 clients served.

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: PAYMENTS MADE TO JEWISH FEDERATION OF METROPOLITAN CHICAGO of $3,936, FOR SPRINGFIELD AND WASHINGTON OFFICES. THE PURPOSE OF THESE PAYMENTS IS FOR THE SOLICITATION OF PUBLIC GRANT FUNDS.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The organization maintains funds that belong to a handful of clients. We receive payments on the clients behalf (eg SSDI) and pay their bills; rent, utilities, etc.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: There are two endowment funds. One is to fund educational scholarships. The other is for emergency assitance to individuals.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The Arks adoption of the Income Tax Topic regarding uncertain tax positions of accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America (GAAPUSA) on July 1, 2009 had no effect on its financial position as management believes The Ark has no material unrecognized income tax benefits, including any potential risk of loss of its not-for-profit tax status. The Ark would account for any potential interest or penalties related to possible future liabilities for unrecognized income tax benefits as income tax expense. The Ark is no longer subject to examination by federal, state or local tax authorities for periods before 2007. Prior to adoption of the Income Tax Topic, the Ark accounted for tax positions under a contingent loss model, requiring recognition of a tax liability when it was both (1) probable that it had been incurred as of year-end and (2) the amount could be reasonably estimated.

Form990ScheduleIPartIII.DescriptionOfNonCashAssistance: FOOD PANTRY ITEMS, MEALS SERVED, FOOD PACKAGES DELIVERED

Form990ScheduleIPartIII.TypeOfGrant: PHARMACY & HEALTH CLINIC (MEDICATIONS, SUPPLIES, TESTS, ETC)

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: MOST CASH GRANTS ARE MADE PAYABLE TO A THIRD PARTY, INSTEAD OF DIRECTLY TO THE RECIPIENT TO ENSURE PROPER USE OF THE FUNDS. FOR EXAMPLE PAYMENTS WOULD BE MADE DIRECTLY TO THE LANDLORD OR UTILITY COMPANY. MOST NON-CASH GRANTS CONSIST OF FOOD (EITHER MEALS SERVED OR FOOD PACKAGES GIVEN TO CLIENTS FROM OUR FOOD PANTRY), OR MEDICATIONS DISPENSED FROM OUR PHARMACY.

Form990ScheduleMPartII.Explanation: A THIRD PARTY ADMINISTERS OUR VEHICLE DONATION PROGRAM. OUR STOCK BROKER SELLS THE DONATED STOCKS THAT OUR ORGANIZATION RECEIVES. THE THRIFT SHOP IS RESPONSIBLE FOR SELLING MOST OF THE OTHER DONATED MERCHANDISE (EXCLUDING FOOD DONATIONS AND PHARMACEUTICAL DONATIONS).

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 4
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE BYLAWS OF THE ORGANIZATION CHANGED FROM HAVING 32 MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS TO A MINIMUM OF 20 AND A MAXIMUM OF 28 MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: JEWISH MEN AND WOMEN WHO HAVE VOLUNTEERED ON THREE SEPARATE OCCASIONS OR CONTRIBUTE $50 OR MORE DURING A FISCAL YEAR ARE CONSIDERED MEMBERS WHO MAY VOTE TO ELECT THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: SEE THE DESCRIPTION FOR QUESTION 6 ABOVE.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 8b
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: MINUTES OF BOARD COMMITTEE MEETINGS ARE OFTEN TAKEN, BUT NOT ALWAYS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION RETAINS THE SERVICES OF AN INDEPENDENT CPA FIRM TO PREPARE THE ORGANIZATION'S FORM 990. MANAGEMENT REVIEWS THE FORM 990 AND PROVIDES A FULL COPY TO THE BUDGET AND FINANCE COMMITTEE FOR REVIEW. A FULL COPY OF THE FORM 990 IS THEN MADE AVAILABLE TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS PRIOR TO FILING THE FORM.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: BOARD MEMBERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES ARE CANVASSED ANNUALLY TO SIGN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENT.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR'S COMPENSATION IS REVIEWED BY THE CO-PRESIDENTS AND CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, AFTER SOLICITING THE INPUT OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. COMPARABILITY DATA MAY BE REVIEWED TO REACH A CONCLUSION. THE COMPENSATION DECISION IS COMMUNICATED IN WRITING. THE CONTROLLER'S COMPENSATION IS REVIEWED BY THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. THE REVIEW MAY CONSIDER COMPARABILITY DATA. THE DECISION IS COMMUNICATED IN WRITING.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: DOCUMENTS ARE NOT PUBLICIZED, BUT MAY BE MADE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
